description:
Ubuntu 12.04 + OpenStack Grizzly from Ubuntu Cloud Archive

After too much struggling I cannot run libvirt+xen fully virtualized guests, but I have managed to run UEC style images that the kernel and ramdisk is running outside the guest. The problem here is that I only get a black VNC window, and no console log output. I am able to connect to the XEN guests using SSH from some other guests running on KVM, so except the described problem, the guest looks like it is running.

The same problem is described here by someone else: https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg03573.html

Also in the log files I see this:
# cat /var/log/xen/qemu-dm-instance-00000089.log
domid: 1
Warning: vlan 0 is not connected to host network
char device redirected to /dev/pts/4
xs_read(): target get error. /local/domain/1/target.
xs_read(): vncpasswd get error. /vm/3cb151cb-8a83-4736-bcce-a9b845da297d/vncpasswd.
char device redirected to /dev/pts/5
title: Libvirt and Xen - No VNC and console log output
